intro: Gayophytum nuttallii var. abramsii, commonly known as the Arizona lily, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has linear, grass-like leaves and produces showy white or pink flowers. Due to its limited range and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
